data.question: What is the DOI of the article discussing charge delocalization and bulk electronic conductivity in mixed-valence metal-organic frameworks?
Which metal-organic framework is discussed in the article for its charge delocalization and bulk electronic conductivity properties?
What method was used for the synthesis of Fe(1,2,3-triazolate)2(BF4)0.22?
data.answer: A purple solution of thianthrenium tetrafluoroborate in MeCN was added to neat pink crystalline powder Fe(tri)2, stirred, filtered, washed, and dried under reduced pressure.

data.question: How was the room-temperature conductivity of Fe(tri)2(BF4)x measured?
data.answer: Using a two-point conductivity measurement apparatus in an argon atmosphere glovebox, through both I-V measurements and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.

data.question: What was the highest room-temperature conductivity value reported for Fe(tri)2(BF4)x and for which x value?
What technique was used to investigate the redox behavior of Fe(tri)2?
data.answer: Slow-scan cyclic voltammetry experiments were carried out to investigate the redox behavior of Fe(tri)2.

data.question: What was the effect of increasing the oxidation level on the conductivity of Fe(tri)2(BF4)x?
data.answer: The conductivity increased dramatically with the oxidation level, with Fe(tri)2(BF4)0.33 displaying a room-temperature conductivity of 0.3(1) S/cm.

data.question: True or False: The article reports that Fe(tri)2(BF4)0.33 exhibits one of the highest conductivity values among three-dimensional metal-organic frameworks.
What was the role of Mössbauer spectroscopy in the study of Fe(tri)2(BF4)x?
data.answer: Mössbauer spectroscopy was used to reveal a high degree of charge delocalization between octahedral low-spin iron(II) and iron(III) centers.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of Fe(tri)2(BF4)x variants involved the use of thianthrenium tetrafluoroborate as an oxidant.
